metadata.title: CVE-2019-12526 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Squid before 4.9. URN response handling in Squidsuffers from a heap-based buffer overflow. When receiving data from aremote server in response to an URN request, Squid fails to ensure that theresponse can fit within the buffer. This leads to attacker controlled dataoverflowing in the heap.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.4
squid-cgi - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.4
squid-common - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.4
squid-purge - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.4
squid3 - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.4
squidclient - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.27-1ubuntu1.4').
